column4: problem: I just installed Ubuntu 6 on my new machine, on the harddrive there is also a version of Window ,i am using a bootmanager to switch between window and Ubuntu, with ubuntu 5.10 i had to install a lilo for correct booting Ubuntu, but Ubuntu 6 installes grub, and after creating a new login on the boot manager, the boot manager refuses to load the new ubuntu setup, how do i force ubuntu to install a lilo for correct loading ubuntu true
Whathappens when you try to boot?
Surely the bector is where GRUB is, not Ubuntu?
sudo apt-get install lilo ?
Use the LiveCD, mount your HD install then use chroot to access it (and bind /dev to the /dev of your system)
If you want lilo boot into a LiveCD (and talk to me, not rtux :))
sorry, i thought he was from the helpdesk
You can boot into a LiveCD then mount your ubuntu system
That lets you access it without booting it, so you can install lilo
me n00b, how to mount ?
sudo mount /dev/<whatever your partition is> /mnt
Are you in a LiveCD with your system mounted at all?
I was..
Just wondering if you still wanted some help
OK, so do you have your Ubuntu partition mounted on /mnt?
So it is mounted somewhere? (/mnt?)
If you do "sudo mount --bind /dev /<wherver ubuntu is mounted>/dev" then "sudo chroot /<wherever ubuntu is mounted>" then you can install lilo
i have mounted the correct partition in the liveCD ,i did a cd /mnt ,do i now install the lilo package in it
You need to do "chroot /mnt" (after binding /dev to /mnt/dev with "sudo mount --bind /dev /mnt/dev")
Then you need a package of Lilo, copy it into /mnt and install it with "dpkg -i lilo*deb" (no sudo needed)
